comment._content: @ olegych76. As were all the others. I doubt any man or boy would have wanted the hell of being in the infantry in such times. In the end the term "Hero" is really just a matter of perspective...

Вторая Мировая Война, Восточный Фронт. Могила героя. Деревянный крест со стальным шлемом и знаком креста у городской стены Смоленска. СССР, Смоленск, 7 ноября 1941

comment.author: 27223070@N04
comment._content:
ditto a best shot. The photographer had talent.

As for  "heroic' it is appropriate, as afar as its intended audience / purpose. Like the previous poster said its ...'a matter of perspective..".

Thanks for posting these. To a student of history these sets offer a view of the "other" side.

Many did their share of invading in those times. It certainly doesn't justify it but one can be sure that the infantry men of both sides were pawns that suffered the political machinations that surrounded them.
Death is death. It is always tragic.
